result.execSummary:
The defendant Gene Arthur Albert Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- 2 days credit in the event of revocation.
- Report to probation by 4:00 pm on 9/2/22

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

2:29 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Gene Arthur Albert Mueller. Defendant Gene Arthur Albert Mueller in court. Atty Dobbe recites agreement. DE sworn. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Court orders: 
I/S 60 days jail
1 year probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- Complete Domestic violence assessment and follow through with recommendations
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment. 
- No abusive contact with T.M.
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court
- Domestic Abuse Surcharge $100; payable through Clerk of Court

2 days jail credit
Defendant to report to probation no later than today at 4:00 pm. 
Apply bond on file, payment plan approved.

Status conference on June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tasha McClafin or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- May retrieve personal belongings ONE time in the presence of law enforcement.
